page.title: 06HISTORY OF COEDPOETH
page.content: The southwest corner of the square comprises of two villages - {Coedpoeth and{Tanyfron.}Land is used for grazing and silage and some industry. { { { }The larger of the two villages, namely{Coedpoeth}or hot wood in English,got its name because Coedpoeth and district was once full of trees which were cut down to make charcoal which was used for melting lead in an area known locally as the{'Smelt'}and for the use in the old furnaces at Bersham,which was wrer John Wilkinson the famous ironmonger had his works.
